data.name: Grade Point Average
data.description:
Given a string of letter grades, separated by spaces, return the GPA.

Background:

Grade point average is a way of reducing a student's grades from various classes into one score. Each class is scored as follows...

- A => 4 points
- B => 3 points
- C => 2 points
- D => 1 point
- F => 0 points

...and the GPA is the average of those scores. For example, a student with four As and one B would have a 3.8 grade point average. 

Details:
- A student will usually have five grades, but it could be any amount
- Some grades may come with a plus or minus, but those have no effect on this calculation and should be ignored (e.g. A+ counts the same as A)
- An empty input should result in a 0.0 GPA
- Inputs will be otherwise valid: no surprise characters, no surprise types
- Round to two decimal places
